item.title: Xp-Modes[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EvilscapeV3 EvilscapeV3
item.description:
@EvilscapeV3 wrote:

[quote="+tyco+, post:16, topic:452708"]So how would the user flaunt the fact that he had got to 126 or 138 using the extreme XP rate ? i dont see the point in this unless it actually gives you a title like for Extreme it would be Legend (Playername) etc. im not trolling or being a dick i simply want to know if there is a way of doing such a thing like the current soulsplit will allow you to because otherwise all people will use easy and claim they used extreme… thanks…

+tyco+[/quote]

ok easy to add. just add a new title , and make it give it to you when you select a mode. I can add it to this if you want.

You can tell someone is on easy, by how much they would hit compared to extreme. A person on extreme be hitting at least 10 over one on easy.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp-Modes[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EvilscapeV3 EvilscapeV3
item.description:
@EvilscapeV3 wrote:

Fragz10:

can’t you just go to config.java?

The normal player can’t edit that. Only owners. your not going edit that for each of your players are you? What this tutorial is for is choosing diffrent exp modes. So someone might be at 1000x exp, and someone at 10x exp.

runescape sucks:

Why have different exp rates? Makes it unfair to the noobs who show off their 99’s and they’re on easy.

True, people on easy well get 99’s quicker, but this 99’s you speak of are only as follows: attack, strength, defense, hitpoints, magic, and range.

This aren’t exactly skills to be barging about in a rsps, since they some of the easiest and first skills you get.

Some people like a challenge, plus you get a pretty good boost to damage hits, and your prayer draining is extremely slow. So it’s really the players choice if they want a hard time getting those 99’s and have good abilities, or simply stick to easy.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp-Modes[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EvilscapeV3 EvilscapeV3
item.description:
@EvilscapeV3 wrote:

Loveandpower:

fair enough was just stating the obvious similarities.

yes, the idea and some code similarities might be identical. I change the credits give him 90%.

Still the changes between his and mine are.

  1. Exp rates actually work
  2. Prayer actually drains, isn’t infinite
  3. A new player joining doesn’t resit everyone to there choice
  4. Server crashing doesn’t equal exp mode resets
  5. Boost to range + mage combat systles even while using prayers.

I just thought i’d release my version with all that fixed. That’s all. I make a few edits to my thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Xp-Modes[PI]
item.dc:creator: @EvilscapeV3 EvilscapeV3
item.description:
@EvilscapeV3 wrote:

Loveandpower:

Making it neater, in such a code nowhere in this small of one gives him that much of a percentage. That’s all I meant to say.

Well ok, The diffrence is his wouldn’t even give exp, cause a lot of pi’s read exp rates of config.java. He didn’t do anything at all with it. So sure you can choose a mode, but your still getting the same old exp rate. As well as quite a lot of bugs.

I gave him 75% cause it was his idea, and I made this after looking at his base code. Still I did this from scratch so none of his code was used.

True RS PS on the commands, part. I just did that. you can easily edit it to use whatever is preferred.

This can just be used as a base, and edit however one might want.

Read full topic
